_exec_summary.SummaryText:
FARMERS UNION COOPERATIVE ASSOCIATION IS AGRICULTURE RETAIL BUSINESS THAT PRIMARLILY HANDELS GRAIN AND SELLS GRAIN AND SELL ANHYDROUS AMMONIA TO AREA CROP PRODUCERS FOR CROP ENHANCEMENT.

THE PLANT CONSIST OF ONE 30,000 AND TWO 11,000 GALLON TANKS WITH A TOTAL CAPACITY OF 243,100 POUNDS.  THIS LOCATION HAS 30 MOBILE NURSE TANKS WITH TOTAL STORAGE CAPICITY OF 140,250, WHICH MAKES THE TOTAL ON SITE CAPACITY 383,350 POUNDS OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.

THE FACILITY IS DESIGNED AND MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE ALL LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS.  THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR FACILITIES ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND WE COMPLY WITH ALL OF THEIR REQUESTS FOR PLANT IMPROVEMENT.

THE WORST CASE SCENARIO WOULD RELEASE OUR LARGEST TANK OF 140250 POUNDS. THE RELEASE AND EMERGENCY PROCEDURES HAS BEEN CORDIANTED WITH THE CITY FIRE DEPARTMENT AND COUNTY LEPC.

THE EMPLOYEES WHO WORK IN THE IN THE AMMONIA PLANT ARE TRAINED ON A REGULAR BASIS IN THE SAFETYINFORMATION, HAZARDS, OPERATING PROCEDURES, AND MAINTENANCE PRACTICES.  WORKERS IN THE AMMONIA PLANT ALWAYS USE GOGGLES AND WEAR THE APPROPIATE GLOVES WHOLE FILLING NURCE TANKS.  CLEAN SAFETY WATER IS ALWAYS PRESENT IS ALWAYS PRESENT DURING AMMONIA HANDLEING OPERATIONS.

THE SAFETY RECORD OF THIS COMPANY IS VERY EVIDENT AND ALLOWS US TO REPORT THAT NO INJURY ACCIDENTS OR LOSS OF PROPERTY HAVE OCCURRED AT THIS STORAGE FACILITY THE PAST FIVE YEARS.

CHANGES THAT NEED TO TAKE PLACE IN THE NEAR FUTURE WOULD BE THA ADDITION OF EMERGENCY SHUT OFF VALVES AT THE BELLY VALVES AND EMERGENCY SHUT OFF VALVES AT THE RISER STAND THAT ACTIVATE WHEN PULL AWAYS HAPPEN.

THE EMERGENCY RESPONCE PLAN HAS BEEN SHARED WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND THEY HAVE TOURED OUR FACILITY TO MAKE THEM MORE AWARE OF THE DANGERS OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  THEY HAVE ALSO AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OR ANY OTHER TYPE OF ACCIDENT THAT MAY OCCUR.
